com.stoyanr.evictor.scheduler

Class AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.evictor.scheduler.AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of keys maintained by this map
    V - the type of mapped values
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    EvictionScheduler<K,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DelayedTaskEvictionScheduler, RegularTaskEvictionScheduler, SingleThreadEvictionScheduler

    public abstract class AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler<K,V>
extends Object
implements EvictionScheduler<K,V>
    An abstract EvictionScheduler which uses an EvictionQueue to store EvictibleEntry instances in the order they should be evicted. This class does not implement the actual eviction functionality, it should be implemented by its subclasses.
    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler()
      Creates an eviction scheduler with a NavigableMapEvictionQueue.
      AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler(EvictionQueue<K,V> queue)
      Creates an eviction scheduler with the specified queue.

      • AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler

      • AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler

        public AbstractQueueEvictionScheduler(EvictionQueue<K,V> queue)
        Creates an eviction scheduler with the specified queue.
        Parameters:
        queue - the queue to be used
        Throws:
        NullPointerExceptin - if the queue is null

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleEviction

        public void scheduleEviction(EvictibleEntry<K,V> e)
        Schedules the eviction of the specified entry from its map. This method is called by the associated instances of ConcurrentMapWithTimedEvictionDecorator just after a new entry has been added. The entry is not guaranteed to be evictible, it may also be a permanent entry. Therefore, the implementation should check if this entry is evictible before doing any scheduling.
        Specified by:
        scheduleEviction in interface EvictionScheduler<K,V>
        Parameters:
        e - the entry for which the eviction should be scheduled, if evictible; it must have been already added to its map

      • cancelEviction

        public void cancelEviction(EvictibleEntry<K,V> e)
        Cancels the eviction of the specified entry from its map. This method is called by the associated instances of ConcurrentMapWithTimedEvictionDecorator just after an entry has been removed. The entry is not guaranteed to be evictible, it may also be a permanent entry. Therefore, the implementation should check if this entry is evictible before doing any cancellation.
        Specified by:
        cancelEviction in interface EvictionScheduler<K,V>
        Parameters:
        e - the entry for which the eviction should be cancelled, if evictible; it must have been already removed from its map

      • evictEntries

        protected void evictEntries()
        Evicts all entries by calling the evictEntries method on the queue. This method should be called by tasks running in dedicated eviction threads that manage the automated eviction.

      • hasScheduledEvictions

        protected boolean hasScheduledEvictions()
        Returns true if there are any evictions scheduled. This simply calls the hasEntries method on the queue.

      • getNextEvictionTime

        protected long getNextEvictionTime()
        Gets the time of the next scheduled eviction, in nanoseconds. This simply calls the getNextEvictionTime method on the queue.

      • onScheduleEviction

        protected abstract void onScheduleEviction(EvictibleEntry<K,V> e)
        Actually schedules the eviction of the specified entry. It is guaranteed that this entry is evictible. Subclasses should override this method to provide the actual scheduling functionality.
        Parameters:
        e - the entry for which the eviction should be scheduled

      • onCancelEviction

        protected abstract void onCancelEviction(EvictibleEntry<K,V> e)
        Actually cancels the eviction of the specified entry. It is guaranteed that this entry is evictible. Subclasses should override this method to provide the actual cancellation functionality.
        Parameters:
        e - the entry for which the eviction should be cancelled

      • onEvictEntries

        protected abstract void onEvictEntries()
        Performs additional activities upon automated eviction of entries, if needed. Subclasses should override this method if they need to perform such activities.
